timeline.bodyText:
this method and it's invocation in de.metas.banking.process.C_Payment_UpdateOrderAndInvoiceId#doIt is unneccesary complex.
Also:

if it starts with is it should return a boolean
don't return a String constant, but (if this method is not removed), an enum

timeline.message:
#7109 - WIP - process now sets the c_order_id and  c_invoice_id for selected payments, if they are available.

Just Need to add call to the payment allocation process after setting invoice and order ids.
#7109 - Also displaying newly added payment rule column.
#7109 - Added payment interceptor to make allocations.
#7109 - Reverted Input Data Source Modifications since we no longer need them.

timeline.bodyText: this import is probably not needed..
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.bodyText: here i think you also need to filter for document status; see de.metas.document.engine.DocStatus#isCompleted
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.bodyText: avoid the n+1 problem by loading all I_C_Invoices at once. Consider using org.compiere.model.IQuery#listDistinct(java.lang.String...) or listIds
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.bodyText: Avoid the n+1 problem; load all records..see that other "n+1" comment of this review
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.bodyText:
I understand that this is aiming at completed payments that get their respective invoice from your process.
So here as well (if i understand it right), you need to check if the payment is even completed.
PS: that check is done in autoAllocateSpecificPayment still i would like the check also in here, to avoid FUD about this method
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.bodyText:
This method and also allocateInvoiceAgainstPaymentIfNecessary seems to me very similar to the one i recently saw in a PR from @TheBestPessimist (AFAIR).
Do we have two versions of it now? If yes, please make sure to consolidate it.
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.bodyText: Avoid passing I_C_Payments. Suggestion: instead of driving the BL from the JavaProcess and, hava just one public method and call that from the process
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.bodyText:
(i wrote this comment after the two that follow in this class)
I understand that this is aiming at completed payments that get their respective invoice from your process.

I think that your process is the only one to set C_Order_ID and C_Invoice_ID on an already completed payment
for not-yet-completed payment, we AFAIU have Cristian's code

=> so, rather that have this model interceptor that "incidentally" allocated the payment,
make the allocation explicitly in the PaymentBL-code that also sets the C_Order_ID and C_Invoice_ID
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.bodyText:
C_Payment has no callout methods AFAIU
Generally, think we should ditch the whole intercheptor; see my comment at C_Payment
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.message:
div minor changes

* use DocStatus.isCompleted()
* C_Invoice: get rid of private one-line deletegate method; also move corresponding tests
* IInvoiceDAO: clean up
* InvoiceDAO: clean up; addInArrayFilter supports RepoIdAware, see javadoc; pulled not-SQL depending method up into AbstractInvoiceDAO
* AbstractInvoiceDAO remove useless methods
* PaymentBL: add `@NonNull final`s

https://github.com/metasfresh/metasfresh/issues/7109
